phishing.description: A fraudulent attempt to obtain sensitive information by impersonating a trustworthy entity.
response_steps: Do not click any suspicious links or download attachments.
Report the email or message to your service provider.
Change your passwords immediately and enable two-factor authentication.
Check your account statements for unauthorized transactions.
emotional_support: Stay calm, phishing attacks are common and can be managed with swift action.
Remember, you are taking the right steps to protect yourself.

ransomware.description: Malicious software that encrypts files and demands ransom to restore access.
response_steps: Disconnect the affected device from all networks immediately.
Do not pay the ransom; it does not guarantee file recovery.
Report the incident to law enforcement and your IT department.
Restore data from backups if available.
emotional_support: Ransomware can be frightening, but help is available.
Focus on containment and recovery to minimize damage.

identity_theft.description: Unauthorized use of someone's personal information for fraudulent purposes.
response_steps: Contact your banks and credit card companies to alert them.
Place a fraud alert or credit freeze with credit bureaus.
File a report with your local police department.
Monitor your accounts and credit reports regularly.
emotional_support: Identity theft is deeply invasive; seeking support is important.
You are not alone; many have successfully recovered from it.
